intro: Pukateria, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, spike-like inflorescences. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Pukateria species are valued for their ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional Māori weaving. Its botanical features make it an important part of New Zealand's native flora.
